content:
ResolveAssemblyReference Class

In this Article

Implements the ResolveAssemblyReference task. Use the ResolveAssemblyReference element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see ResolveAssemblyReference Task.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ResolveAssemblyReference : Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • Task
  • Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension
  • ResolveAssemblyReference

Inherited Members

,

Constructors summary

ResolveAssemblyReference()

Initializes a new instance of the ResolveAssemblyReference class.

Properties summary

AllowedAssemblyExtensions

Gets or sets the assembly extensions that will be considered during references resolution.
AllowedRelatedFileExtensions

Gets or sets the extensions that will be considered when searching for related files.
AppConfigFile

Gets or sets the App.Config file path.
Assemblies

Gets or sets the assembly names to resolve into full paths and to find dependencies for.
AssemblyFiles

Gets or sets a list of fully qualified assembly paths to find dependencies for.
AutoUnify

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the resulting dependency graph is automatically treated as if there were an App.Config file passed in to the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.AppConfigFile* property.
CandidateAssemblyFiles

Gets or sets a list of assemblies, which must be absolute file names or project-relative file names, to use for the search and resolution process.
CopyLocalDependenciesWhenParentReferenceInGac

Gets or sets a switch that determines how dependencies are determined, and whether or not a dependency is copied locally.
CopyLocalFiles

Returns all files in the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ResolvedFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ResolvedDependencyFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.RelatedFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.SatelliteFiles*, and ResolveAssemblyReference properties that have the CopyLocal item metadata with a value of true.
FilesWritten

Gets or sets the items written to disk.
FindDependencies

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether dependencies will be found (true) or only primary references will be found (false).
FindRelatedFiles

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether related files such as .pdb files and .xml files will be found.
FindSatellites

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether satellite assemblies will be found.
FindSerializationAssemblies

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the serialization assemblies will be found.
FullFrameworkAssemblyTables

Gets or sets a list of items representing XML files that contain the full framework for the profile.
FullFrameworkFolders

Gets or sets a list of folders which contain a RedistList directory which represent the full framework for a given client profile, for example:%programfiles%\reference assemblies\microsoft\framework\v4.0
FullTargetFrameworkSubsetNames

A string that contains the names of the subsets of the specified target framework.
IgnoreDefaultInstalledAssemblySubsetTables

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the task should look for and use additional installed assembly subset tables (also known as Subset Lists), which are found in the SubsetList directory under the provided TargetFrameworkDirectories.
IgnoreDefaultInstalledAssemblyTables

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the ResolveAssemblyReference task should ignore additional installed assembly tables found in the RedistList directory underneath the provided crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.TargetFrameworkDirectories* (true) or should search for and use these installed assembly tables (false).
IgnoreTargetFrameworkAttributeVersionMismatch

Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to ignore the framework attribute when checking if an assembly is compatible with the targeted framework.
IgnoreVersionForFrameworkReferences

Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to ignore the version information on the framework assembly and actually resolve the framework assembly from the currently targeted framework. Flag applies if the primary reference is a framework assembly.
InstalledAssemblySubsetTables

An ITaskItem that represents a list of XML files that contain assemblies that are expected to be in the target subset.
InstalledAssemblyTables

Gets or sets a list of XML files that contain assemblies that are expected to be installed on the target machine.
LatestTargetFrameworkDirectories

Gets or sets the list of directories which contain the redist lists for the most current framework which can be targeted on the machine.
ProfileName

Gets or sets the name of the target framework profile we are targeting, for example Client, Web, or Network
RelatedFiles

Gets related files, such as .xml and .pdb files with the same base name as a reference.
ResolvedDependencyFiles

Gets the nth order paths to dependencies.
ResolvedFiles

Gets a list of all primary references resolved to full paths.
ResolvedSDKReferences

A list of resolved SDK references which contain the sdk name, sdk location and the targeted configuration.

These locations will only be searched if the reference has the SDKName metadata attached to it.
SatelliteFiles

Gets any satellite files found.
ScatterFiles

Gets the scatter files associated with one of the given assemblies.
SearchPaths

Specifies the directories or special locations that are searched to find the files on disk that represent the assemblies.
SerializationAssemblyFiles

Gets the serialization assemblies.
Silent

Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether no messages are logged.
StateFile

Gets or sets a file name that indicates where to save the intermediate build state for this task.
SuggestedRedirects

Gets one item for every distinct conflicting assembly identity, regardless of the value of the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.AutoUnify* property.
TargetedRuntimeVersion

Gets or sets the name of the runtime we are targeting, for example, 2.0.57027.
TargetFrameworkDirectories

Gets or sets the path to the target framework directory.
TargetFrameworkMoniker

Gets or sets the target framework moniker being targeted, if any.
TargetFrameworkMonikerDisplayName

Gets or sets the display name of the target framework moniker being targeted, if any.
TargetFrameworkSubsets

A list of target framework subset names that will be searched for in the target framework directories.
TargetFrameworkVersion

Gets or sets the project target framework version used for reference filtering.
TargetProcessorArchitecture

Gets or sets the preferred target processor architecture used for resolving Global Assembly Cache (GAC) references, which can have a value of x86, IA64, or AMD64.
WarnOrErrorOnTargetArchitectureMismatch

Gets or sets a string value specifying the behavior when a mismatch between the target processor architecture and the architecture of a primary reference. When this is â€œErrorâ€, an error will be logged for a mismatch. When this is â€œWarningâ€, a warning will be logged for a mismatch. When this is â€œNoneâ€, no error or warning will be logged for a mismatch.

Methods summary

Execute()

Executes the ResolveAssemblyReference task.

Constructors

  • ResolveAssemblyReference()

    Initializes a new instance of the ResolveAssemblyReference class.

    public ResolveAssemblyReference ();

Properties

  • AllowedAssemblyExtensions

    Gets or sets the assembly extensions that will be considered during references resolution.

    public string[] AllowedAssemblyExtensions { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      The assembly extensions that will be considered during references resolution.

    Remarks

    The default extensions are .dll and .exe.

  • AllowedRelatedFileExtensions

    Gets or sets the extensions that will be considered when searching for related files.

    public string[] AllowedRelatedFileExtensions { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      The extensions that will be considered when searching for related files.

    Remarks

    The default extensions are .pdb and .xml.

  • AppConfigFile

    Gets or sets the App.Config file path.

    public string AppConfigFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The App.Config file path.

    Remarks

    If this property is specified, the AutoUnify property must be false.

  • Assemblies

    Gets or sets the assembly names to resolve into full paths and to find dependencies for.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] Assemblies { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The assembly names to resolve into full paths and to find dependencies for.

    Remarks

    The assembly names can either be simple or strong names.

  • AssemblyFiles

    Gets or sets a list of fully qualified assembly paths to find dependencies for.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] AssemblyFiles { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The list of fully qualified assembly paths to find dependencies for.

  • AutoUnify

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the resulting dependency graph is automatically treated as if there were an App.Config file passed in to the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.AppConfigFile* property.

    public bool AutoUnify { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the resulting dependency graph is automatically treated as if there were an App.Config file passed in to the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.AppConfigFile* property.

    Remarks

    The default value is false.

    For more information about this property, see ResolveAssemblyReference Task

  • CandidateAssemblyFiles

    Gets or sets a list of assemblies, which must be absolute file names or project-relative file names, to use for the search and resolution process.

    public string[] CandidateAssemblyFiles { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      The list of assemblies to use for the search and resolution process.

    Remarks

    Assemblies in this list will be considered when the SearchPaths property contains {CandidateAssemblyFiles} as one of the paths to consider.

  • CopyLocalDependenciesWhenParentReferenceInGac

    Gets or sets a switch that determines how dependencies are determined, and whether or not a dependency is copied locally.

    public bool CopyLocalDependenciesWhenParentReferenceInGac { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if when determining if a dependency should be copied locally one of the checks done is to see if the parent reference in the project file has the Private metadata set or not. If that metadata is set then we will use that for the dependency as well.

      If the metadata is not set then the dependency will go through the same checks as the parent reference. One of these checks is to see if the reference is in the GAC. If a reference is in the GAC then we will not copy it locally as it is assumed it will be in the gac on the target machine as well. However this only applies to that specific reference and not its dependencies.

      This means a reference in the project file may be copy local false due to it being in the GAC but the dependencies may still be copied locally because they are not in the GAC. This is the default behavior for RAR and causes the default value for this property to be true.

      Returns false if we will still check project file references to see if they are in the GAC and set their copy local state as appropriate.

      However for dependencies we will not only check to see if they are in the GAC but we will also check to see if the parent reference from the project file is in the GAC.

      If the parent reference from the project file is in the GAC then we will not copy the dependency locally.


      If there are multiple parent reference and ANY of them does not come from the GAC then we will set copy local to true.
  • CopyLocalFiles

    Returns all files in the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ResolvedFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ResolvedDependencyFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.RelatedFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.SatelliteFiles*, and ResolveAssemblyReference properties that have the CopyLocal item metadata with a value of true.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] CopyLocalFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      All files in the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ResolvedFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ResolvedDependencyFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.RelatedFiles*, crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.SatelliteFiles*, and crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.ScatterFiles* properties that have the CopyLocal item metadata with a value of true.

  • FilesWritten

    Gets or sets the items written to disk.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] FilesWritten { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The items written to disk.

  • FindDependencies

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether dependencies will be found (true) or only primary references will be found (false).

    public bool FindDependencies { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if dependencies will be found; false if only primary references will be found.

    Remarks

    The default value is true.

  • FindRelatedFiles

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether related files such as .pdb files and .xml files will be found.

    public bool FindRelatedFiles { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if related files such as .pdb files and .xml files will be found; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is true.

  • FindSatellites

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether satellite assemblies will be found.

    public bool FindSatellites { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if satellite assemblies will be found; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is true.

  • FindSerializationAssemblies

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the serialization assemblies will be found.

    public bool FindSerializationAssemblies { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the serialization assemblies will be found; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is true.

  • FullFrameworkAssemblyTables

    Gets or sets a list of items representing XML files that contain the full framework for the profile.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] FullFrameworkAssemblyTables { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      Returns a list of items representing XML files that contain the full framework for the profile.

    Remarks

    Normally nothing is passed in here, this is for the cases where the location of the xml file for the full framework is not under a RedistList folder.

    Format of the file is like: etc. 

    <FileList Redist="MatchingRedistListName" >  
  <File AssemblyName="System" Version="2.0.0.0"  
    PublicKeyToken="b77a5c561934e089" Culture="neutral"  
    ProcessorArchitecture="MSIL" FileVersion="2.0.40824.0" InGAC="true"  
  />  
// etc.  
</FileList>

    Items in this list must specify the "FrameworkDirectory" metadata to associate an redist list with a particular framework directory. If the association is not made an error will be logged. The reason is, The logic in RAR assumes if a FrameworkDirectory is not set it will use the target framework directory.

  • FullFrameworkFolders

    Gets or sets a list of folders which contain a RedistList directory which represent the full framework for a given client profile, for example:%programfiles%\reference assemblies\microsoft\framework\v4.0

    public string[] FullFrameworkFolders { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      Returns a list of folders which contain a RedistList directory which represent the full framework for a given client profile

  • FullTargetFrameworkSubsetNames

    A string that contains the names of the subsets of the specified target framework.

    public string[] FullTargetFrameworkSubsetNames { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      A string value that contains subset names.

    Remarks

    Provides a set of names that, if seen in the TargetFrameworkSubset list, causes TargetFrameworkSubsets to be ignored.

  • IgnoreDefaultInstalledAssemblySubsetTables

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the task should look for and use additional installed assembly subset tables (also known as Subset Lists), which are found in the SubsetList directory under the provided TargetFrameworkDirectories.

    public bool IgnoreDefaultInstalledAssemblySubsetTables { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if additional assembly subset tables are used; otherwise, false.

  • IgnoreDefaultInstalledAssemblyTables

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether the ResolveAssemblyReference task should ignore additional installed assembly tables found in the RedistList directory underneath the provided crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.TargetFrameworkDirectories* (true) or should search for and use these installed assembly tables (false).

    public bool IgnoreDefaultInstalledAssemblyTables { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the task should ignore the additional installed assembly tables; false if the task should search for and use the additional installed assembly tables.

    Remarks

    The default value is false.

  • IgnoreTargetFrameworkAttributeVersionMismatch

    Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to ignore the framework attribute when checking if an assembly is compatible with the targeted framework.

    public bool IgnoreTargetFrameworkAttributeVersionMismatch { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • IgnoreVersionForFrameworkReferences

    Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to ignore the version information on the framework assembly and actually resolve the framework assembly from the currently targeted framework. Flag applies if the primary reference is a framework assembly.

    public bool IgnoreVersionForFrameworkReferences { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns the flag.

  • InstalledAssemblySubsetTables

    An ITaskItem that represents a list of XML files that contain assemblies that are expected to be in the target subset.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] InstalledAssemblySubsetTables { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      An ITaskItem list of XML files.

    Remarks

    This is the format of the file: 

    <FileList Redist="ClientSubset" >  
    <File AssemblyName="System" Version="2.0.0.0"   
      PublicKeyToken="b77a5c561934e089" Culture="neutral"   
      ProcessorArchitecture="MSIL" FileVersion="2.0.40824.0"   
      InGAC="true" />  
    etc.  
</FileList>

    Items in this list may optionally specify the "FrameworkDirectory" metadata to associate an InstalledAssemblySubsetTable with a particular framework directory. If there is only a single TargetFrameworkDirectories element, then any items in this list that do not have the "FrameworkDirectory" metadata will be treated as though the metadata is set to the lone (unique) value passed to TargetFrameworkDirectories.

  • InstalledAssemblyTables

    Gets or sets a list of XML files that contain assemblies that are expected to be installed on the target machine.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] InstalledAssemblyTables { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      A list of XML files that contain assemblies that are expected to be installed on the target machine.

  • LatestTargetFrameworkDirectories

    Gets or sets the list of directories which contain the redist lists for the most current framework which can be targeted on the machine.

    public string[] LatestTargetFrameworkDirectories { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      Returns the list of directories which contain the redist lists for the most current framework which can be targeted on the machine. If this is not set Then we will looks for the highest framework installed on the machine for a given target framework identifier and use that.

  • ProfileName

    Gets or sets the name of the target framework profile we are targeting, for example Client, Web, or Network

    public string ProfileName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the name of the target framework profile we are targeting, for example Client, Web, or Network

  • RelatedFiles

    Gets related files, such as .xml and .pdb files with the same base name as a reference.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] RelatedFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The related files.

  • ResolvedDependencyFiles

    Gets the nth order paths to dependencies.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] ResolvedDependencyFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The nth order paths to dependencies.

  • ResolvedFiles

    Gets a list of all primary references resolved to full paths.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] ResolvedFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The list of all primary references resolved to full paths.

  • ResolvedSDKReferences

    A list of resolved SDK references which contain the sdk name, sdk location and the targeted configuration.

    These locations will only be searched if the reference has the SDKName metadata attached to it.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] ResolvedSDKReferences { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      Returns ITaskItem.

  • SatelliteFiles

    Gets any satellite files found.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] SatelliteFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      Any satellite files found.

    Remarks

    The satellite files will have the CopyLocal item metadata with a value of true if the reference or dependency that caused this item to exist also has a CopyLocal item metadata set to true.

  • ScatterFiles

    Gets the scatter files associated with one of the given assemblies.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] ScatterFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The scatter files associated with one of the given assemblies.

  • SearchPaths

    Specifies the directories or special locations that are searched to find the files on disk that represent the assemblies.

    public string[] SearchPaths { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      The directories or special locations that are searched to find the files on disk that represent the assemblies.

  • SerializationAssemblyFiles

    Gets the serialization assemblies.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] SerializationAssemblyFiles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The serialization assemblies.

  • Silent

    Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether no messages are logged.

    public bool Silent { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if no messages are logged; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is false.

  • StateFile

    Gets or sets a file name that indicates where to save the intermediate build state for this task.

    public string StateFile { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The file name that indicates where to save the intermediate build state for this task.

  • SuggestedRedirects

    Gets one item for every distinct conflicting assembly identity, regardless of the value of the crosoft.Build.Tasks.ResolveAssemblyReference.AutoUnify* property.

    public Microsoft.Build.Framework.ITaskItem[] SuggestedRedirects { get; }

    Property Value

    • ITaskItem[]

      The items that correspond to distinct conflicting assembly identities.

    Remarks

    The items include culture and PKT that were found and that did not have a suitable bindingRedirect entry in the application configuration file.

  • TargetedRuntimeVersion

    Gets or sets the name of the runtime we are targeting, for example, 2.0.57027.

    public string TargetedRuntimeVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the name of the runtime we are targeting, for example, 2.0.57027. A "v" may be prefixed to the name.

  • TargetFrameworkDirectories

    Gets or sets the path to the target framework directory.

    public string[] TargetFrameworkDirectories { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      The path to the target framework directory.

    Remarks

    This property is required to determine the CopyLocal status for resulting items.

    If this property is not specified, no resulting items will be have a CopyLocal value of true unless they explicitly have a Private metadata value of true on their source item.

  • TargetFrameworkMoniker

    Gets or sets the target framework moniker being targeted, if any.

    public string TargetFrameworkMoniker { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the target framework moniker being targeted, if any. Returns an empty string by default.

    Remarks

    This is used for logging purposes.

  • TargetFrameworkMonikerDisplayName

    Gets or sets the display name of the target framework moniker being targeted, if any.

    public string TargetFrameworkMonikerDisplayName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns the display name of the target framework moniker being targeted, if any.

    Remarks

    This is used only for logging.

  • TargetFrameworkSubsets

    A list of target framework subset names that will be searched for in the target framework directories.

    public string[] TargetFrameworkSubsets { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      To be added.

  • TargetFrameworkVersion

    Gets or sets the project target framework version used for reference filtering.

    public string TargetFrameworkVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The project target framework version used for reference filtering.

    Remarks

    The default value is an empty string.

  • TargetProcessorArchitecture

    Gets or sets the preferred target processor architecture used for resolving Global Assembly Cache (GAC) references, which can have a value of x86, IA64, or AMD64.

    public string TargetProcessorArchitecture { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The preferred target processor architecture used for resolving Global Assembly Cache (GAC) references.

  • WarnOrErrorOnTargetArchitectureMismatch

    Gets or sets a string value specifying the behavior when a mismatch between the target processor architecture and the architecture of a primary reference. When this is â€œErrorâ€, an error will be logged for a mismatch. When this is â€œWarningâ€, a warning will be logged for a mismatch. When this is â€œNoneâ€, no error or warning will be logged for a mismatch.

    public string WarnOrErrorOnTargetArchitectureMismatch { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Returns a string value of â€œErrorâ€, â€œWarningâ€ or â€œNoneâ€.

Methods

  • Execute()

    Executes the ResolveAssemblyReference task.

    public override bool Execute ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if task execution succeeded; otherwise, false.
